meaning: not long after one ordained; shortly after ordination
example_1: acir'ūpasampanno kho pan'āyasmā bhāradvājo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto viharanto nacirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti
upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam'antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
example_2: sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṃ ten'upasaṅkami divāvihārāya. andhavanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṃ supupphitasālarukkhamūle aṭṭhāsi.
example_3: tatra'pi evaṃ aṭṭhāsiṃ evaṃ nisīdiṃ evaṃ abhāsiṃ evaṃ tuṇhī ahosiṃ

example_1: tassā puriso sotena vuyhamāno kāse ce'pi gaṇheyya, te palujjeyyuṃ. so tatonidānaṃ anayabyasanaṃ āpajjeyya.
example_2: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, maccho gilabaḷiso bāḷisikassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāḷisikassa.

example_1: appamāṇo buddho, appamāṇo dhammo. appamāṇo saṅgho, pamāṇavantāni siriṃsapāni ahivicchikā satapadī, uṇṇanābhī sarabū mūsikā.
example_2: iti uddham'adho tiriyaṃ sabbadhi sabb'attatāya sabbāvantaṃ lokaṃ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
example_3: yathā divā tathā rattiṃ, yathā rattiṃ tathā divā, abhibhuyya disā sabbā, appamāṇasamādhinā.
example_4: dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, kasiṇ'āyatanāni. katamāni dasa? pathavīkasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.

meaning: not celibate; not leading the holy life; sexually active
example_1: pare abrahmacārī bhavissanti, mayam'ettha brahmacārī bhavissāmā'ti sallekho karaṇīyo.
example_2: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ dussīlaṃ pāpadhammaṃ asuciṃ saṅkassarasamācāraṃ paṭicchannakamm'antaṃ asamaṇaṃ samaṇapaṭiññaṃ abrahmacāriṃ brahmacāripaṭiññaṃ antopūtiṃ avassutaṃ kasambujātaṃ majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnaṃ
example_3: adinnādāyissa purisapuggalassa adinnādānā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya. abrahmacārissa purisapuggalassa abrahmacariyā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya.

example_1: alattha kho kasibhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, alattha upasampadaṃ.
example_2: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n'eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam'eva alattha

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto, assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño, abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.
idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto, assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño, abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.

meaning: name of an arahant monk; attendant of the Buddha; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great learning, remembrance, conduct, resoluteness and service
example_1: yāyaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi na c'ābhinato na c'āpanato na ca sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato, vimuttattā ṭhito, ṭhitattā santusito, santusitattā no paritassati. ayaṃ, bhante ānanda, samādhi kiṃphalo vutto bhagavatā'ti?
example_2: evañ'ca vadehi, sādhu kira, bhante, ayyo ānando yena bhikkhun'upassayo yena sā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti.
example_3: passatha no tumhe, ānanda, taṃ vacanapathaṃ aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā yaṃ tumhe n'ādhivāseyyāthā'ti?
example_4: etaṃ santaṃ etaṃ paṇītaṃ yadidaṃ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabb'ūpadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo nirodho nibbānan'ti. ayaṃ vuccata-ananda, nirodhasaññā.

meaning: fallen into; entered into; met with
example_1: kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca panimassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa.
example_2: kicchaṃ vat'āyaṃ satto āpanno, app'eva nāma imamhā dukkhā mucceyyā'ti karuṇā pavattetabbā.
example_3: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ, bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivāda-āpannānaṃ, upassutiṃ tiṭṭheyya
example_4: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, maccho gilabaḷiso bāḷisikassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāḷisikassa.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bāḷisiko āmisagataṃ baḷisaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya. tam'enaṃ aññataro āmisacakkhu maccho gileyya.

meaning: sir; sirs; venerable; venerables; reverend; reverends
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya, sammukhā m'etaṃ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṃ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṃ,
example_2: na kho pan'āhaṃ, āvuso, appatvā lokassa antaṃ dukkhassa antakiriyaṃ vadāmi
example_3: cittasmiṃ vasībhūt'āmhi, iddhipādā subhāvitā, sabbabandhanamutt'āmhi, na taṃ bhāyāmi āvuso'ti.

example_1: dīgharattaṃ kho maṃ tvaṃ, devi, iṭṭhehi kantehi piyehi manāpehi samudācarittha, atha ca pana maṃ tvaṃ pacchime kāle aniṭṭhehi akantehi appiyehi amanāpehi samudācarasī'ti
example_2: pañca kho ime, sunakkhatta, kāmaguṇā. katame pañca? cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā
example_3: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato
example_4: katamo ca, bhikkhave, piyehi vippayogo dukkho? idha yassa te honti iṭṭhā kantā manāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā

meaning: here one; here a certain; in this case some; some people here
example_1: pittasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... semhasamuṭṭhānāni'pi ... vātasamuṭṭhānāni'pi … sannipātikāni'pi … utupariṇāmajāni'pi … visamaparihārajāni'pi … opakkamikāni'pi … kammavipākajāni'pi kho, sīvaka, idh'ekaccāni vedayitāni uppajjanti.
example_2: evam'eva kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, idh'ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi, tath'āyaṃ puggalo paṭipanno tathā ca iriyati tañ'ca maggaṃ samārūḷho yathā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjissatī'ti.
example_3: evam'eva kho, sunakkhatta, ṭhānam'etaṃ vijjati yaṃ idh'ekacco purisapuggalo lok'āmis'ādhimutto assa.
example_4: evam'evaṃ kho idh'ekacco bhikkhu yaññad'eva rattiṃ vā divaṃ vā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito hoti

example_1: so iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti
example_2: imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṃ vā abhavissa brahmaññaṃ vā dukkaraṃ sudukkaraṃ, n'etaṃ abhavissa kallaṃ vacanāya, dukkaraṃ sāmaññaṃ dukkaraṃ brahmaññan'ti.
example_3: tañ'ce bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ, nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo'ti

example_1: seyyathā'pi, gāmaṇi, puriso mahatiṃ puthusilaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya.
example_2: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ udakarahade mahākummakulaṃ ciranivāsī ahosi.

example_1: es'āhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca, labheyyāhaṃ bhoto gotamassa santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan'ti.
example_2: nihacca jāṇuṃ vanditvā, sammukhā añjaliṃ akaṃ, ehi bhadde'ti maṃ avaca, sā me āsu-upasampadā.

example_1: ujugatacitto kho pana, mahānāma, ariyasāvako labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhamma-upasaṃhitaṃ pāmojjaṃ.
example_2: tesaṃ vitakkānaṃ vitakkasaṅkhārasaṇṭhānaṃ manasikaroto ye pāpakā akusalā vitakkā chand'ūpasaṃhitā'pi dos'ūpasaṃhitā'pi moh'ūpasaṃhitā'pi te pahīyanti
example_3: cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā, sotaviññeyyā saddā

meaning: likewise; just like this; similarly; so too
example_1: yathā'pi mūle anupaddave daḷhe, chinno'pi rukkho puna'r'eva rūhati, evam'pi taṇh'ānusaye anūhate, nibbattatī dukkham'idaṃ punappunaṃ.
example_2: supinena yathā'pi saṅgataṃ, paṭibuddho puriso na passati, evam'pi piyāyitaṃ janaṃ, petaṃ kālakataṃ na passati.
example_3: evam'pi kho ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo tehi bhikkhūhi samanuyuñjiyamāno samanugāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno tadeva pāpakaṃ diṭṭhigataṃ thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharati
example_4: aho vata m'āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā āyatim'pi evarūpena paṇītena piṇḍapātena pariviseyyā'ti evam'pi'ssa na hoti.

example_1: pharusaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti
example_2: pañca kho ime, sunakkhatta, kāmaguṇā. katame pañca? cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā
example_3: rūpā saddā rasā gandhā, phassā dhammā ca kevalā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā ca, yāvat'atthī'ti vuccati.
example_4: cakkhuviññeyyānaṃ rūpānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ manoramānaṃ lok'āmisapaṭisaṃyuttānaṃ paṭilābhaṃ vā paṭilābhato samanupassato

example_1: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ dussīlaṃ pāpadhammaṃ asuciṃ saṅkassarasamācāraṃ paṭicchannakamm'antaṃ asamaṇaṃ samaṇapaṭiññaṃ abrahmacāriṃ brahmacāripaṭiññaṃ antopūtiṃ avassutaṃ kasambujātaṃ majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnaṃ
idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto, assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño, abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.

meaning: work to be done; duties to do
example_1: idha, gahapati, ekacco gihīhi saṃsaṭṭho viharati sahanandī sahasokī, sukhitesu sukhito, dukkhitesu dukkhito, uppannesu kiccakaraṇīyesu attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, gahapati, gāme santhavajāto hoti.
example_2: santi hi, moggallāna, kulesu kiccakaraṇīyāni

example_1: satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ, payutto te damessāmi, vīriyadhuraniggahito, na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā'ti.
example_2: te hi sotthiṃ gamissanti, kacche vāmakase magā, jhānāni upasampajja, ekodi nipakā satā'ti.
example_3: atha kho aññe imaṃ bhogaṃ paṭipajjissanti, ahaṃ pana yathākammaṃ gamissāmī'ti.
example_4: appasaddo antaraghare gamissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, gāmaṇi, puriso mahatiṃ puthusilaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya.
example_2: yathā'pi rahado gambhīro, vippasanno anāvilo, evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna, vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.
example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bāḷisiko āmisagataṃ baḷisaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya. tam'enaṃ aññataro āmisacakkhu maccho gileyya.

example_1: app'eva nām'etaṃ māluvābījaṃ moro vā gileyya, mago vā khādeyya, davaḍāho vā ḍaheyya, vanakammikā vā uddhareyyuṃ, upacikā vā uṭṭhaheyyuṃ, abījaṃ vā pan'assā'ti.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bāḷisiko āmisagataṃ baḷisaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya. tam'enaṃ aññataro āmisacakkhu maccho gileyya.

example_1: cattār'imāni, gahapati, sukhāni adhigamanīyāni gihinā kāmabhoginā kālena kālaṃ samayena samayaṃ upādāya. katamāni cattāri? atthisukhaṃ, bhogasukhaṃ, ānaṇyasukhaṃ, anavajjasukhaṃ.
example_2: tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhopannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.
example_3: yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ tiṇ'avatthārakena vūpasameyya, ṭhapetvā thullavajjaṃ, ṭhapetvā gihippaṭisaṃyuttan'ti.
example_4: mam'eva kata'maññantu, gihīpabbajitā ubho, mam'ev'ātivasā assu, kicc'ākiccesu kismici. iti bālassa saṅkappo, icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

example_1: gopālako sāyanhasamaye sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātetvā iti paṭisañcikkhati, ajja kho gāvo amukasmiñ'ca amukasmiñ'ca padese cariṃsu
example_2: ekādasahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato gopālako abhabbo gogaṇaṃ pariharituṃ phātiṃ kātuṃ. katamehi ekādasahi?
example_3: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye kiṭṭhasambādhe gopālako gāvo rakkheyya. so tā gāvo tato tato daṇḍena ākoṭeyya paṭikoṭeyya sannirundheyya sannivāreyya.

meaning: and further; and what is more
example_1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imam'eva kāyaṃ yathāṭhitaṃ yathāpaṇihitaṃ dhātuso paccavekkhati atthi imasmiṃ kāye pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū'ti

example_1: idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno mettaṃ kāyakammaṃ ... paccupaṭṭhitaṃ hoti sabrahmacārīsu āvi c'eva raho ca
example_2: abrahmacariyaṃ pahāya brahmacārī hoti ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā.
example_3: attā have jitaṃ seyyo, yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā, attadantassa posassa, niccaṃ saññatacārino.

example_1: cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, dhammā sāraṇīyā piyakaraṇā garukaraṇā saṅgahāya avivādāya sāmaggiyā ekībhāvāya saṃvattanti.
example_2: katamā ca, bhikkhave, saññā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, saññākāyā, rūpasaññā, saddasaññā, gandhasaññā, rasasaññā, phoṭṭhabbasaññā, dhammasaññā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, saññā.
example_3: katamā ca, bhikkhave, taṇhā? cha'y'ime, bhikkhave, taṇhākāyā, rūpataṇhā, saddataṇhā, gandhataṇhā, rasataṇhā, phoṭṭhabbataṇhā, dhammataṇhā. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, taṇhā.

example_1: saṃvāsena kho, mahārāja, sīlaṃ veditabbaṃ tañ'ca kho dīghena addhunā na ittaraṃ, manasikarotā no amanasikarotā, paññavatā no duppaññena
example_2: lok'āmis'ādhimuttassa kho, sunakkhatta, purisapuggalassa tappatirūpī c'eva kathā saṇṭhāti, tadanudhammañ'ca anuvitakketi, anuvicāreti, tañ'ca purisaṃ bhajati, tena ca vittiṃ āpajjati
example_3: yañ'ca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno tañ'ca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari c'assa moho āropetabbo
example_4: yathā ca anuppannassa byāpādassa uppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti, yathā ca uppannassa byāpādassa pahānaṃ hoti tañ'ca pajānāti, yathā ca pahīnassa byāpādassa āyatiṃ anuppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti.

example_1: tañ'ce aññātako gahapati vā gahapatānī vā bahūhi cīvarehi abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāreyya, santar'uttaraparamaṃ tena bhikkhunā tato cīvaraṃ sāditabbaṃ. tato ce uttari sādiyeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
example_2: ñāṇavādañ'ca, āvuso, bhikkhu vadamāno bhāvanāvādañ'ca, jānām'imaṃ dhammaṃ, passām'imaṃ dhammaṃ, bhāvitakāyo'mhi bhāvitasīlo bhāvitacitto bhāvitapañño'ti. tañ'ce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho n'ābhibhuyya tiṭṭhati
example_3: tañ'ce bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ, nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo'ti

example_1: anattamanatā ca attamanatā ca, tadubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako viharati sato sampajāno.
example_2: nānappakārakaṃ nāma katam'pi akatam'pi kat'ākatam'pi. kataṃ nāma sīs'ūpagaṃ gīv'ūpagaṃ hatth'ūpagaṃ pād'ūpagaṃ kaṭ'ūpagaṃ. akataṃ nāma ghanakataṃ vuccati. kat'ākataṃ nāma tadubhayaṃ.
example_3: yañ'ca tadubhayaṃ paṭicca uppajjati saṃyojanaṃ tañ'ca pajānāti, yathā ca anuppannassa saṃyojanassa uppādo hoti tañ'ca pajānāti
example_4: sace ākaṅkhati, paṭikūlañ'ca appaṭikūlañ'ca tadubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyyaṃ sato sampajāno'ti

example_1: yo ca vassasataṃ jīve, dussīlo asamāhito, ek'āhaṃ jīvitaṃ seyyo, sīlavantassa jhāyino.
example_2: ahaṃ nāgo'va saṅgāme, cāpato patitaṃ saraṃ, ativākyaṃ titikkhissaṃ, dussīlo hi bahujjano.
example_3: dussīlo, bhikkhave, sīlakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti.
example_4: yo ca kho mātāpitaro dussīle sīlasampadāya samādapeti niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti, .. ettāvatā kho mātāpitūnaṃ katañ'ca hoti paṭikatañ'ca

meaning: pleased with mental phenomena; enjoying thinking
example_1: kāyo kho, māgaṇḍiya, phoṭṭhabb'ārāmo phoṭṭhabbarato ... mano kho, māgaṇḍiya, dhamm'ārāmo dhammarato dhammasammudito. so tathāgatassa danto gutto rakkhito saṃvuto, tassa ca saṃvarāya dhammaṃ deseti.
app'evanāmimassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa antakiriyā paññāyethā'ti
example_2: seyyathā'pi nāma pakkhī sakuṇo yena yen'eva ḍeti, sapattabhārova ḍeti
example_3: seyyathā'pi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṃ vā bāhaṃ pasāreyya
example_4: sīlagandhasamo gandho, kuto nāma bhavissati, yo samaṃ anuvāte ca, paṭivāte ca vāyati.

example_1: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ
example_2: idh'āhaṃ, bhante, aḍḍakaraṇe nisinno passāmi khattiyamahāsāle'pi brāhmaṇamahāsāle'pi gahapatimahāsāle'pi aḍḍhe mahaddhane mahābhoge pahūtajātarūparajate pahūtavitt'ūpakaraṇe pahūtadhanadhaññe kāmahetu kāmanidānaṃ kām'ādhikaraṇaṃ sampajānamusā bhāsante.

example_1: nissitassa calitaṃ, anissitassa calitaṃ n'atthi. calite asati passaddhi, passaddhiyā sati nati na hoti. natiyā asati āgatigati na hoti. āgatigatiyā asati cut'ūpapāto na hoti. cut'ūpapāte asati n'ev'idha na huraṃ na ubhayam'antarena. es'ev'anto dukkhassā'ti.
example_2: sabbesu kāmesu yo vītarāgo, ākiñcaññaṃ nissito hitvā m'aññaṃ, saññāvimokkhe parame'dhimutto, tiṭṭheyya so tattha anānuyāyī.
example_3: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, mahācoro balavanissito hoti? idha, bhikkhave, mahācoro rājānaṃ vā rājamahāmattānaṃ vā nissito hoti.
example_4: yaṃ yadeva hi sā, bhikkhave, gāvī niccammā nissāya tiṭṭheyya, ye tan'nissitā pāṇā te naṃ khādeyyuṃ.

meaning: it would be apparent; it would be evident; it could be discerned
example_1: app'evanām'imassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa antakiriyā paññāyethā'ti
example_2: ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
example_3: kāmadhātuvepakkañ'ca, ānanda, kammaṃ n'ābhavissa, api nu kho kāmabhavo paññāyethā'ti? no h'etaṃ bhante

meaning: liberation by understanding; emancipation by insight
example_1: so sace ākaṅkhati, āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan'ti, tatra tatr'eva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane'ti.
example_2: cetovimuttihīnā te, atho paññāvimuttiyā, abhabbā te antakiriyāya, te ve jātijar'ūpagā.

meaning: with concealed deeds; who is furtive in action; who is underhanded in business; (comm) bad deed
example_1: yo katvā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ, mā maṃ jaññā'ti icchati, yo paṭicchannakamm'anto, taṃ jaññā vasalo iti.
example_2: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto, assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño, abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.

example_1: sādhu khv'assa, bhikkhave, yaṃ idh'ekacco sakyaputtiyapaṭiñño evarūpam'pi attabhāvapaṭilābhaṃ paṭisaṃvediyetha.
example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, api nu so puriso divasaṃ tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno tatonidānaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvediyethā'ti?

example_1: tatra bhikkhu vivekaninnena cittena vivekapoṇena vivekapabbhārena vivekaṭṭhena nekkhamm'ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanikapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ'y'eva kathaṃ kattā hoti
example_2: bhikkhu ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ bhāvento ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ bahulīkaronto nibbānaninno hoti nibbānapoṇo nibbānapabbhāro

example_1: ye ariyasaccāni vibhāvayanti, gambhīrapaññena sudesitāni. kiñ'cā'pi te honti bhusappamattā, na te bhavaṃ aṭṭhamam'ādiyanti.
example_2: uṭṭhahatha nisīdatha, daḷhaṃ sikkhatha santiyā, mā vo pamatte viññāya, maccurājā amohayittha vas'ānuge.
example_3: unnaḷassa pamattassa, bāhir'āsassa bhikkhuno, sīlaṃ samādhi paññā ca, pāripūriṃ na gacchati.
example_4: appamādo amatapadaṃ, pamādo maccuno padaṃ, appamattā na mīyanti, ye pamattā yathā matā.

example_1: yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṃ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṃ vā
example_2: sa kho so, gahapati, ariyasāvako uṭṭhānavīriy'ādhigatehi bhogehi bāhābalaparicitehi sed'āvakkhittehi dhammikehi dhammaladdhehi imāni cattāri pattakammāni kattā hoti.

example_1: tassa evaṃ yoniso manasikaroto tīṇi saṃyojanāni pahīyanti, sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso. ime vuccanti, bhikkhave, āsavā dassanā pahātabbā
example_2: maraṇena'pi taṃ pahīyati, yaṃ puriso mam'idan'ti maññati, etam'pi viditvā paṇḍito, na mamattāya nametha māmako.
example_3: yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ, etth'esā taṇhā pahīyamānā pahīyati, ettha nirujjhamānā nirujjhati.
example_4: asubhanimittaṃ yoniso manasi karoto anuppanno c'eva kāmacchando n'uppajjati uppanno ca kāmacchando pahīyati

example_1: tasmā hi paññā'va dhanena seyyā, yāya vosānam'idh'ādhigacchati. abyositattā hi bhavābhavesu, pāpāni kammāni karoti mohā.
example_2: buddho susuddho karuṇāmah'aṇṇavo, yo'ccantasuddhabbarañāṇalocano, lokassa pāp'ūpakilesaghātako
example_3: atha pāpāni kammāni, karaṃ bālo na bujjhati, sehi kammehi dummedho, aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.
example_4: ko nu kho, bhante hetu, ko paccayo pāpassa kammassa kiriyāya pāpassa kammassa pavattiyā'ti?

example_1: kāsāvakaṇṭhā bahavo, pāpadhammā asaññatā, pāpā pāpehi kammehi, nirayaṃ te upapajjare.
example_2: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ dussīlaṃ pāpadhammaṃ asuciṃ saṅkassarasamācāraṃ paṭicchannakamm'antaṃ asamaṇaṃ samaṇapaṭiññaṃ abrahmacāriṃ brahmacāripaṭiññaṃ antopūtiṃ avassutaṃ kasambujātaṃ majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnaṃ

meaning: far side; far shore; bank on the other side (of); epithet of Nibbāna
example_1: alattakakatā pādā, mukhaṃ cuṇṇakamakkhitaṃ. alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.
example_2: appakā te manussesu, ye janā pāragāmino. ath'āyaṃ itarā pajā, tīram'ev'ānudhāvati.
example_3: oraṃ samuddassa atittarūpo, pāraṃ samuddassa'pi patthayetha, rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā, avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti, ūnāva hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na hatthi titti.
example_4: yaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vedagum'ābhijaññā, akiñcanaṃ kāmabhave asattaṃ, addhā hi so ogham'imaṃ atāri, tiṇṇo ca pāraṃ akhilo akaṅkho.

example_1: gopālako sāyanhasamaye sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātetvā iti paṭisañcikkhati, ajja kho gāvo amukasmiñ'ca amukasmiñ'ca padese cariṃsu
sabbe tasanti daṇḍassa, sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ piyaṃ, attānaṃ upamaṃ katvā, na haneyya na ghātaye.
example_2: manussānaṃ piyo hoti, amanussānaṃ piyo hoti, devatā rakkhanti, n'āssa aggi vā visaṃ vā satthaṃ vā kamati, tuvaṭaṃ cittaṃ samādhiyati, mukhavaṇṇo vippasīdati
example_3: pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.

meaning: fermented; foul-smelling; fetid; stinking; rotten; putrid
example_1: añjanī'va navā cittā, pūtikāyo alaṅkato. alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.
example_2: pūtimacchaṃ kus'aggena, yo naro upanayhati, kusā'pi pūti vāyanti, evaṃ bāl'ūpasevanā.
example_3: evam'evaṃ te pūtimuttabhesajjaṃ khāyissati santuṭṭhassa viharato ratiyā aparitassāya phāsuvihārāya okkamanāya nibbānassa
example_4: evam'evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, iminā pūtikāyena aṭṭīyāmi harāyāmi jigucchāmi.

example_1: āmisaṃ'va macchānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti yathā macchānaṃ vadh'atthāya baḷisalaggaṃ āmisaṃ khipati, evaṃ tayā pasaṃsamānena ete rūpā sattānaṃ vadhāya khittā'ti vadati.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bāḷisiko āmisagataṃ baḷisaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya. tam'enaṃ aññataro āmisacakkhu maccho gileyya.

example_1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, bāḷisiko āmisagataṃ baḷisaṃ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipeyya. tam'enaṃ aññataro āmisacakkhu maccho gileyya.
example_2: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, maccho gilabaḷiso bāḷisikassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāḷisikassa.

meaning: living the holy life; following the spiritual path
example_1: yo, bhikkhave, evaṃ vadeyya, yathā yath'āyaṃ puriso kammaṃ karoti tathā tathā taṃ paṭisaṃvediyatī'ti, evaṃ santaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyavāso na hoti, okāso na paññāyati sammā dukkhassa antakiriyāya.
example_2: ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

meaning: pretending to be celibate; claiming to be chaste
example_1: idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo dussīlo hoti pāpadhammo asuci saṅkassarasamācāro paṭicchannakamm'anto, assamaṇo samaṇapaṭiñño, abrahmacārī brahmacāripaṭiñño, antopūti avassuto kasambujāto.
phandamānaṃ pajaṃ disvā, macche app'odake yathā, aññam'aññehi byāruddhe, disvā maṃ bhayam'āvisi.
example_2: pūtimacchaṃ kus'aggena, yo naro upanayhati, kusā'pi pūtī vāyanti, evaṃ bāl'ūpasevanā.
example_3: seyyathā'pi pabbatasaṅkhepe udakarahado accho vippasanno anāvilo. tattha cakkhumā puriso tīre ṭhito passeyya sippisambukam'pi sakkharakathalam'pi macchagumbam'pi, carantam'pi tiṭṭhantam'pi.
example_4: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, maccho gilabaḷiso bāḷisikassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāḷisikassa.

example_1: sabbehi me piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo'ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
example_2: pharusaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, yā sā vācā n'elā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅ'gamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti
example_3: ākaṅkheyya ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu, sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo c'assaṃ manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā'ti, sīlesv'ev'assa paripūrakārī ajjhattaṃ cetosamatham'anuyutto anirākatajjhāno vipassanāya samannāgato brūhetā suññ'āgārānaṃ.
example_4: pañca kho ime, sunakkhatta, kāmaguṇā. katame pañca? cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā

meaning: name of an arahant monk; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in analytical understanding
example_1: āyasmatā ca sāriputtena āyasmatā ca mahāmoggallānena āyasmatā ca mahākassapena āyasmatā ca mahākaccāyanena āyasmatā ca mahākoṭṭhikena āyasmatā ca mahākappinena
example_2: ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
example_3: ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca, duppañño duppañño'ti

meaning: as long as; as far as; of all; to the extent that
example_1: tiṭṭhañ'caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat'assa vigatamiddho, etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam'etaṃ vihāraṃ idha'm'āhu.
example_2: sa kho so, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati, na kho ahaññ'ev'eko jarādhammo jaraṃ anatīto, atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ āgati gati cuti upapatti sabbe sattā jarādhammā jaraṃ anatītā'ti.
example_3: yāvatā kho, āvuso, appamāṇā cetovimuttiyo, akuppā tāsaṃ cetovimutti aggam'akkhāyati. sā kho pan'ākuppā cetovimutti suññā rāgena, suññā dosena, suññā mohena.
example_4: yāvatā channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ gati tāvatā papañcassa gati, yāvatā papañcassa gati tāvatā channaṃ phass'āyatanānaṃ gati.

example_1: atha kho nakulapitā gahapati bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāy'āsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā yen'āyasmā sāriputto ten'upasaṅkami
example_2: yaṃnūna mayaṃ yen'āyasmā mahākaccāno ten'upasaṅkameyyāma, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ etam'atthaṃ paṭipuccheyyāmā'ti

meaning: delighted (with); devoted (to); taking pleasure (in); pleased (with); enjoying
example_1: iti bhinnānaṃ vā sandhātā sahitānaṃ vā anuppadātā samagg'ārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti
example_2: tass'āhaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā, vihāsiṃ sāsane rato, samādhiṃ paṭipādesiṃ, uttam'atthassa pattiyā.
example_3: evaṃ visesato ñatvā, appamādamhi paṇḍitā, appamāde pamodanti, ariyānaṃ gocare ratā.
example_4: idha, gahapati, ariyasāvako vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. ayaṃ vuccati, gahapati, cāgasampadā.

example_1: yathā'pi rahado gambhīro, vippasanno anāvilo, evaṃ dhammāni sutvāna, vippasīdanti paṇḍitā.
example_2: yadūnakaṃ taṃ saṇati, yaṃ pūraṃ santam'eva taṃ, aḍḍhakumbh'ūpamo bālo, rahado pūro'va paṇḍito.
example_3: seyyathā'pi puriso sappikumbhaṃ vā telakumbhaṃ vā gambhīraṃ udakarahadaṃ ogāhitvā bhindeyya. tatra yā assa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa

meaning: may I get; I would like to receive
example_1: labheyy'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike upasampadan'ti. paripuṇṇaṃ pana te, bhikkhu, pattacīvaran'ti? na kho me, bhante, paripuṇṇaṃ pattacīvaran'ti. na kho, bhikkhu, tathāgatā aparipuṇṇapattacīvaraṃ upasampādentī'ti.
example_2: evam'evaṃ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito. es'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavantaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañ'ca bhikkhusaṅghañ'ca. labheyy'āhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṃ, labheyyaṃ upasampadan'ti.

meaning: suspect; dodgy; doubtful; (comm) remembered with suspicion
example_1: yaṃ kiñci sithilaṃ kammaṃ, saṃkiliṭṭhañ'ca yaṃ vataṃ, saṅkassaraṃ brahmacariyaṃ, na taṃ hoti mahapphalan'ti.
example_2: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ dussīlaṃ pāpadhammaṃ asuciṃ saṅkassarasamācāraṃ paṭicchannakamm'antaṃ asamaṇaṃ samaṇapaṭiññaṃ abrahmacāriṃ brahmacāripaṭiññaṃ antopūtiṃ avassutaṃ kasambujātaṃ majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnaṃ

example_1: yaṃ kiñci sithilaṃ kammaṃ, saṃkiliṭṭhañ'ca yaṃ vataṃ, saṅkassaraṃ brahmacariyaṃ, na taṃ hoti mahapphalan'ti.
example_2: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ dussīlaṃ pāpadhammaṃ asuciṃ saṅkassarasamācāraṃ paṭicchannakamm'antaṃ asamaṇaṃ samaṇapaṭiññaṃ abrahmacāriṃ brahmacāripaṭiññaṃ antopūtiṃ avassutaṃ kasambujātaṃ majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnaṃ

meaning: remains still; stands still; settles down
example_1: tesaṃ pahānā ajjhattam'eva cittaṃ santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati.
example_2: so, bhikkhave, samayo yaṃ taṃ cittaṃ ajjhattaṃ'y'eva santiṭṭhati sannisīdati ekodi hoti samādhiyati. so hoti samādhi santo paṇīto paṭippassaddhiladdho ekodibhāv'ādhigato na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato.
example_3: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno papañcanirodhe cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati. nippapañc'ārāmass'āyaṃ

meaning: claiming to be a monk; pretending to be a monastic
example_1: addasā kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno taṃ puggalaṃ dussīlaṃ pāpadhammaṃ asuciṃ saṅkassarasamācāraṃ paṭicchannakamm'antaṃ asamaṇaṃ samaṇapaṭiññaṃ abrahmacāriṃ brahmacāripaṭiññaṃ antopūtiṃ avassutaṃ kasambujātaṃ majjhe bhikkhusaṅghassa nisinnaṃ
bhikkhu pan'eva aññataraṃ gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā upanissāya viharati kuladūsako pāpasamācāro, tassa kho pāpakā samācārā dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca, kulāni ca tena duṭṭhāni dissanti c'eva suyyanti ca
example_2: parisuddho no vacīsamācāro bhavissati uttāno vivaṭo na ca chiddavā saṃvuto ca
example_3: codakena bhikkhunā paraṃ codetu'kāmena evaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ, parisuddhakāyasamācāro nu kho'mhi?

meaning: sharing in each other's happiness; rejoicing together
example_1: idha, gahapati, ekacco gihīhi saṃsaṭṭho viharati sahanandī sahasokī, sukhitesu sukhito, dukkhitesu dukkhito, uppannesu kiccakaraṇīyesu attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, gahapati, gāme santhavajāto hoti.

meaning: sharing in one another's sorrows; grieving together
example_1: idha, gahapati, ekacco gihīhi saṃsaṭṭho viharati sahanandī sahasokī, sukhitesu sukhito, dukkhitesu dukkhito, uppannesu kiccakaraṇīyesu attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati. evaṃ kho, gahapati, gāme santhavajāto hoti.
pañcakāmaguṇike rāge pariññāte n'atthi taṃ saṃyojanaṃ yena saṃyojanena saṃyutto ariyasāvako puna imaṃ lokaṃ āgaccheyya
example_2: imamhi ce, bhikkhave, samaye uṇṇābho brāhmaṇo kālaṅ'kareyya, n'atthi saṃyojanaṃ yena saṃyojanena saṃyutto uṇṇābho brāhmaṇo puna imaṃ lokaṃ āgaccheyyā'ti.
example_3: diṭṭhisaṃyojanasaṃyutto assutavā puthujjano na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi
example_4: ayaṃ vuccati, brāhmaṇa, aparisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carati, saṃyutto methunena saṃyogena.

example_1: tam'enaṃ jano disvā evaṃ vadeyya, bhogī vata, bho, puriso, evaṃ kira bhogino bhogāni bhuñjantī'ti. tam'enaṃ sāmikā yattha yatth'eva passeyyuṃ tattha tatth'eva sāni hareyyuṃ. taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā'ti?
example_2: assāmikan'ti na añño koci sāmiko hoti, itthī vā puriso vā gahaṭṭho vā pabbajito vā.
example_3: gopālako sāyanhasamaye sāmikānaṃ gāvo niyyātetvā iti paṭisañcikkhati, ajja kho gāvo amukasmiñ'ca amukasmiñ'ca padese cariṃsu

meaning: polite; pleasant; charming; (comm) fit to be remembered
example_1: sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sārāṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā daṇḍam'olubbha ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhāsi

meaning: name of an arahant monk; chief disciple; great disciple of the Buddha; foremost disciple in great wisdom
example_1: āraddhavīriyo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vattā, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. vacanakkhamo, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. codako, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto. pāpagarahī, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto.
example_2: evaṃ vutte, āyasmā puṇṇo mantāṇiputto āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca, ko nāmo āyasmā, kathañ'ca pan'āyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti? upatisso'ti kho me, āvuso, nāmaṃ, sāriputto'ti ca pana maṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī'ti.
example_3: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.
example_4: sādh'āvuso'ti kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko āyasmato sāriputtassa bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ uttariṃ pañhaṃ apucchi.

example_1: dānaṃ dadantu saddhāya, sīlaṃ rakkhantu sabbadā, bhāvan'ābhiratā hontu, gacchantu devatāgatā.
example_2: puna caparaṃ, mahānāma, ariyasāvako attano sīlāni anussarati akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni.
example_3: kacci nu kho me attā sīlato na upavadatī'ti pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ
example_4: kikī'va aṇḍaṃ, camarī'va vāladhiṃ. piyaṃ'va puttaṃ, nayanaṃ'va ekakaṃ. tath'eva sīlaṃ, anurakkhamānā.

example_1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sukhaṃ vā vedanaṃ vedayamāno sukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti. dukkhaṃ vā vedanaṃ vedayamāno dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti.
example_2: anicce, bhikkhave, niccan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso. dukkhe, bhikkhave, sukhan'ti saññāvipallāso cittavipallāso diṭṭhivipallāso.
example_3: ev'āhaṃ ajānanto evarūpaṃ sukhaṃ vedanaṃ pajahathā'ti vadeyyaṃ, api nu me etaṃ, bhikkhave, patirūpaṃ abhavissā'ti?
example_4: atthi, bhikkhave, samādhibhāvanā bhāvitā bahulīkatā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṃvattati

example_1: chinda sotaṃ parakkamma, kāme panūda brāhmaṇa. nappahāya munī kāme, n'ekattam'upapajjati.
example_2: savanti sabbadhi sotā, sotānaṃ kiṃ nivāraṇaṃ, sotānaṃ saṃvaraṃ brūhi, kena sotā pidhiyyare.
example_3: evañ'hi so, bhikkhave, majjhe nadiyā soto vikkhitto visaṭo byādiṇṇo n'eva dūraṅ'gamo assa na sīghasoto na hārahārī .
example_4: abhabbo'va tāva kālaṃ kātuṃ yāva na sot'āpattiphalaṃ sacchikaroti.

meaning: religious duty; spiritual practice; ritual observance; vow
example_1: yaṃkiñci sithilaṃ kammaṃ, saṅkiliṭṭhañ'ca yaṃ vataṃ, saṅkassaraṃ brahmacariyaṃ, na taṃ hoti mahapphalan'ti
example_2: sayaṃ samādāya vatāni jantu, ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati saññasatto, vidvā ca vedehi samecca dhammaṃ, na ucc'āvacaṃ gacchati bhūripañño.
example_3: suddhassa ve sadā phaggu, suddhass'uposatho sadā, suddhassa sucikammassa, sadā sampajjate vataṃ.
example_4: yo attano sīlavatāni jantu, anānupuṭṭho'va paresa pāva, anariyadhammaṃ kusalā tam'āhu, yo ātumānaṃ sayam'eva pāva.

example_1: aṭṭh'imāni, bhikkhave, kusītavatthūni. katamāni aṭṭha?
example_2: mettāya cetovimuttiyā āsevitāya bhāvitāya bahulīkatāya yānīkatāya vatthukatāya anuṭṭhitāya paricitāya susamāraddhāya ekādas'ānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.

example_1: yath'indakhīlo pathaviṃ sito siyā, catubbhi vātehi asampakampiyo. tath'ūpamaṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi, yo ariyasaccāni avecca passati.
example_2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, pathaviyā lekhā khippaṃ lujjati vātena vā udakena vā, na ciraṭṭhitikā hoti, evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, idh'ekacco puggalo abhiṇhaṃ kujjhati. so ca khv'assa kodho na dīgharattaṃ anuseti.
example_3: subh'ānupassiṃ viharantaṃ, indriyesu asaṃvutaṃ, bhojanamhi c'āmattaññuṃ, kusītaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ, taṃ ve pasahati māro, vāto rukkhaṃ'va dubbalaṃ.
example_4: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ānisaṃsā yāguyā. katame pañca? khuddaṃ paṭihanati, pipāsaṃ paṭivineti, vātaṃ anulometi, vatthiṃ sodheti, ām'āvasesaṃ pāceti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ānisaṃsā yāguyā'ti.

example_1: patirūpadesavāso ca, pubbe ca katapuññatā. attasammāpaṇidhi ca, etam'maṅgalam'uttamaṃ.
example_2: anāpatti leṇe guhāya tiṇakuṭikāya aññass'atthāya vās'āgāraṃ ṭhapetvā sabbattha, anāpatti ummattakassa ādikammikassā'ti.
example_3: upanītavayo ca dāni'si, sampayāto'si yamassa santike, vāso te n'atthi antarā, pātheyyam'pi ca te na vijjati.
example_4: ettako ce'pi, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho abhavissa nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo, na'y'idaṃ brahmacariyavāso paññāyetha sammā dukkhakkhayāya.

meaning: comprehends; understands; recognises; distinguishes; is aware (of)
example_1: viññāṇaṃ viññāṇan'ti, āvuso, vuccati. kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso, viññāṇan'ti vuccatī'ti? vijānāti vijānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā viññāṇan'ti vuccati.
example_2: yāvajīvam'pi ce bālo, paṇḍitaṃ payirupāsati, na so dhammaṃ vijānāti, dabbī sūparasaṃ yathā.
example_3: iti h'etaṃ vijānāma, navamo so parābhavo. dutiyaṃ bhagavā brūhi, kiṃ parābhavato mukhaṃ.
example_4: kiñ'ca vijānāti? ambilam'pi vijānāti, tittakam'pi vijānāti, kaṭukam'pi vijānāti, madhuram'pi vijānāti, khārikam'pi vijānāti, akhārikam'pi vijānāti, loṇikam'pi vijānāti, aloṇikam'pi vijānāti.

meaning: could be known; should be recognized
example_1: kāyaviññeyyā phoṭṭhabbā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām'ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā, ime kho, sunakkhatta, pañca kāmaguṇā.
example_2: yaṃ papañceti tatonidānaṃ purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti atīt'ānāgatapaccuppannesu cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu

meaning: having known; having perceived; having understood
example_1: uposathakammassa pattakallattaṃ viditvā idāni kariyamāno uposatho saṅghena anumānetabbo.
example_2: kittayissāmi te dhammaṃ, diṭṭhe dhamme anītihaṃ, yaṃ viditvā sato caraṃ, tare loke visattikaṃ.
example_3: ayaṃ samaṇo gotamo āgacchati. appasaddakāmo kho so āyasmā appasaddassa vaṇṇavādī. app'eva nāma appasaddaṃ parisaṃ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṃ maññeyyā'ti. evaṃ vutte te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṃ.
example_4: kumbh'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā, nagar'ūpamaṃ cittam'idaṃ ṭhapetvā. yodhetha māraṃ paññ'āvudhena, jitañ'ca rakkhe anivesano siyā.
